abstract: Zines, small do-it-yourself publications that originated in the 1930s, are enjoying a comeback among the Web-savvy; their creators say zines offer a respite from endless onslaught of digital media; most zines are labors of love, done as side projects and hobbies.
snippet: Zines, small do-it-yourself publications that originated in the 1930s, are enjoying a comeback among the Web-savvy.
lead_paragraph: Zines, small do-it-yourself publications that originated in the 1930s, are enjoying a comeback among the Web-savvy.

headline.main: Raised on the Web, but Liking a Little Ink
headline.print_headline: Raised on the Web, But Liking a Little Ink
headline.seo: Zines Have a Resurgence Among the Web-Savvy
